events.event_description: EIA begins publishing new forecasts for total distillate fuel oil consumption and biofuel data series in the Short-Term Energy Outlook.
events.citation: Beginning in the September 2024 Short-Term Energy Outlook (STEO), we began publishing forecasts for several new series that help to better capture how biofuels are being consumed and overall demand for distillate fuel oil

events.event_description: Renewable diesel supply has more than tripled from 70,000 barrels per day to 240,000 barrels per day due to increased private investment in production capacity.
events.citation: Renewable diesel product supplied has more than tripled from nearly 70,000 barrels per day (b/d) in 2021 to 240,000 b/d so far this year, as an influx of private investment helped increase production capacity.

events.event_description: Total distillate consumption surpasses 2019 levels, showing full recovery in the market when accounting for biofuels.
events.citation: However, the total distillate fuel oil consumption series that more fully accounts for biofuels shows distillate consumption surpassing 2019 levels in 2022.

events.event_description: Biofuels share of total distillate fuel oil consumption increases from 5% to 7%, with further growth expected.
events.citation: Recently, rising production of renewable diesel has increased the biofuels share of total distillate fuel oil consumption from 5% in 2021 to 7% in 2023. We expect the biofuels share of total distillate fuel oil consumption will increase to 9% in 2024.
